WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for reporting this! The issue has been fixed and can be tried out in the upcoming 0.9.5 release. We also have a beta available (https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=TypeScript%200.9.5%20beta) if you'd like to try it out.
WorkItem.Description:
I have a .ts file not set as Build Action=TypeScriptCompile (set as None actually).
Yet when file is opened in Visual Studio 2012 the Error List window lists its errors.

Is this by design? Is there a way to turn off this behavior as I don't want Error List window pollution.
WorkItem.Summary: VS outputs errors for open .ts file even though not marked as TypeScriptCompile
